page.title: 16WOODHORN COLLIERY
page.content: WOODHORN COLLIERY IS GOING TO BE PART OF THE QUEEN ELIZEBETH THE SECOND PARK.IT IS GOING TO BE A MUSEUM ABOUT MINING.THERE ARE GOING TO BE 53.000 TREES ROUND THE MUSEUM.THE CAGE THAT TOOK THE MINERS DOWN WILL STILL BE WORKING TO SHOW VISITORS WHAT IT WAS LIKE. THE COUNCIL ARE ALSO GOING TO MAKE SOME MODELS.ONE WILL BE OF ALL THE MINES WANSBECK WITH A TRAIN GOING ROUND PICKING UP THE COAL.THE OTHER ONE WILL BE OF WOODHORN COLLIERY. CHILDREN WILL GET IN FREE BUT IF THEY WANT TO GO ON ANY OF THE AMUSEMENTS (WHICH MAY BE INCLUDED IN THE MUSEUM THEY WILL HAVE TO PAY. BEFORE THE COLLIERY WAS CLOSED IN 1981 IT WAS VERY WET AND VERY DIRTY.
